subject: Personal Finance
title: Starting Early vs Starting Big
description: A quick win: understand Starting Early vs Starting Big.

hook.text: Person A saves $200/month from age 25 to 35 then stops. Person B starts at 35 and saves until 65.

buildup.text: Person A invested $24,000 total. Person B invested $72,000 â€” three times as much.

discovery.text: At 7% returns, Person A still ends up with more money at age 65. Early start wins.

twist.text: Ten years of compounding gave A's smaller sum enough time to outgrow B's larger contributions.

climax.text: The best time to start saving was years ago. The second best time is right now.

punchline.text: Time beats money in the compounding game.

quiz.question: Why can someone who saves less end up with more in retirement?
options: Starting earlier gives compound interest more time to work
